Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 11:29AM scarp wrote: Swm63:  I began CMF yesterday.  My oncotype was a 15, 1.2 cm, stage1, grade 2, 0/7 nodes, ER/PR+, Her2-.  I debated for 3 weeks on whether or not even to do chemo.  Finally decided on the CMF since my 1st onc threw it out there.  I don't think the current onc would have given it to me as he thinks the TC is more cutting edge.  He did agree to the CMF.  There is a very long thread on CMF under help me get thru treatment. The nurse who administered the CMF yesterday told me the last few people she had that took CMF did not lose their hair.  They had thinning.  I asked if I should order a wig and she told me not to.  Hair doesn't begin to thin or fall out after the 3rd or 4th treatment.  side effeccts aren't supposed to be so bad.  I did get a little woozy today but not bad. It only took about an hour to administer where the other is baout 2 1/2.  I am going for about 8 treatments.  One every three weeks. Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: help! TC or CMF swm63 penny3333

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2008 05:42AM scarp wrote: From what I've experied thru all my testing is that if you later in the week, like Wed - Friday you will wait until Monday.  Best going to a hospital where they will read the results the same day.  The 5 day I had to wait really sucked, mine was done on a Wed.
Posts.Title: Had the biopsies -- now the wait tooz61 Beesie

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2009 07:02AM scarp wrote: I had a trip planned to the caribbean before rads and they told me not to expose my chest to the sun.  It was really hard but I bought bathing suits that came up higher on my chest and put zinc oxide on my entire chest, even under the suit before going out in the sun.  It really helped alot.  I did not burn at all and tanned slightly.  After being in the sun I was sure to moistuize and before bed used vitamin e oil on my chest.

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2008 07:59AM scarp wrote: I, too may be starting in Oct.  Still have not made up my mind on wheter or not to do the chemo I'm a mom of 2, 10 and 12 and have ben married16 years.  The kids still don't know that the lump that was removed was cancerous.. I had a lumpectomy on 8/8/08, 1.2cm,stage 1, ER/PR+, Her2-, 0/7, grade 2 nodes and an oncotype score of 15.  They first called with my results and said I had a 9 so it was just going to be rad/tam.  Now I'm faced with new choices since it is a 15 and still considered grey. I am more or less being told it is a personal choice.  The 2 onc said if it was them, they would lean towards the chemo due to my age and family history.  Mom had BC.  Braca 1 neg, braca 2 was inconclusive. In discussing chemo, I have a choice of Taxatere or CMF.  I'm leaning towards the CMF since it seems less toxic.  They said it would be a dose every 3 weeks and there would 8 doses.  Still no guarantee I wouldn't lose my hair.  It would thin most likey.  I do have very thick short hair.  It is a longer regiment but they told me it only takes 45 min. to administer.  I am waitng for the result of another test, maybe it is aduvent to show me how much the chemo will truly help me.  Prayinghands...if a CAT scan is similar or the same as a CT scan (which I had) its nothing.  You drink barium, which doens't taste too bad) over a period of an hour before and the scan itself is only 7 minutes long.  I never found the tests for anything to be bad...its just the roller coaster ride of waiting for results
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2008 09:40PM scarp wrote: Well ladies, never thought I was going to say this but I'm now bummed I wasn't able to start my CMF today!  Went to the dentist who sent me to a periodontist who found some significant bone loss in a tooth.  Needless to say, I'll be having oral surgery on Friday.  Can't start chemo until my mouth is all clear (2 -3) weeks.  It took me 2 weeks to decide whether or not to do chemo since my oncotype was a 15.  So I finally decide to go ahead and look what happens.  I feel sick over the whole thing. I'm now starting to worry that I won't be able to start until Nov.  How long is too long?  My lumpectomy was on 8/8??? I'm wondering if the tooth thing is sign telling me not to do the chemo?
Posts.Title: Anyone starting chemo in October 08? SuzyWillKickThis unique

Posts.Content: Nov 18, 2008 06:53AM scarp wrote: I had a 1.2 cm, stage 1, grade 2, 0/7 nodes, ER+/PR+, Her2- with an onco of 15. 2 oncs and my surgeon gave me a choice of having or not having chemo.  They did all suggest that I was still in the grey area and they would personally do the chemo.  so...here I am starting my second round of CMF tomorrow. I am 46, premenopausal with a mother who had bc.
Posts.Title: Should I choose chemo or not? lmrunner Seabee

Posts.Content: Nov 26, 2008 12:04AM scarp wrote: apfuentes - my surgeon told my husband after my surgery that it would most likely need chemo since the tumor was over 1cm.  She told me the same thing after my sugery follow-up.  I was really bummed cuz all along they really thought it would be rad and tam.  i suppose they were hoping that the tumor was actually smaller than it appeared on the mri.  it actually was.  the mri showed it at about 1.5cm. get your 2nd opinion and go from there. with an oncotype of 30 i would not even question the chemo.   isn't 31 where chemo is a must?
Posts.Title: Chemo or Not? apfuentes Seabee

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2009 08:46PM scarp wrote: My breasts are very dense and I need to go every 6 months.  They want to be careful and a bseline MRI isn't so bad.  You are best getting it.  They wouldn't order it for no reason.  It is pretty easy. You'll feel better once you have it.
Posts.Title: Dense Tissue & Cysts....MRI? Liz1969 Liz1969

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2008 11:40AM scarp wrote: Unfortuantely you have to make up your own mind.  They say to do what you will feel best with. I had IDC, 1.2 cm, 0/7 nodes ER+/PR+, Her2 -, stage 1 grade 2.  My oncotype was a 15.  The 2 oncs I saw and my surgeon never told me what to do but were leaning me towards the chemo. Mainly due to my age (46) and the size of the tumor.  Pre onco type they did chemo on any tumor over 1 cm.  Chemo only reduced my reoccurance by 3%. I know its not big but my likilhood of reccurance after onco was 9% with rad and tamoxofen.  Bringing it down to 6% sounds so much better.  You can always do a clinical trial.  That will make up your mind for you. My surgery was on 8/8 and didn't make up my mind until the beg. of Oct.  Keep in mind that people who get recontructed don't start a treatment until they are healed which takes time. Take your time and really think about it.  It may help to make a list of pros and cons. I searched for every reason to not do chemo.  Nothing convinced me 100%. I've begun CMF which doesn't seem as bad as other out there.  I'm doing great on it. Making my decision was very tough but I'm happy with it.
Posts.Title: Chemo or Not? apfuentes Seabee

Posts.Content: Oct 29, 2008 06:47PM scarp wrote: I have very dense breasts.  My OB/GYN sent me for an ultrasound in '07 and found a fibroadanoma(spelling?) which I had biopsied and was neg as they suspected.  On 6/12 I went for a mammography and it was clear.  On the same day my ultra sound was scheduled and it was not clear.  After they marked the suspicious area with a big fat X and did a second mammo on the exact suspicious spot did they find the tumor. I have become a real pain in the ass with my family and friends about making their annual appointments and keeping them.  If I were you, get the ultrasound for a baseline if not for anything else. I am so thankful that I have such a great OB/GYN.
Posts.Title: I'm not actually worried, but I need some opinions KiminNewOrleansLA pk0199

Posts.Content: Oct 23, 2008 08:40AM scarp wrote: My mom was diagnosed at 49 with BC.  She died at 66, 3 1/2 years ago.  My sister, about 4 yrs ago had calcifications and was considered a neg stage cancer, she is now on tamox.  She was found to be Braca1 & 2 neg.  I had a lumpectomy for a 1.2 cm IDC.  I am Braca 1 -, and brac2  is unspecifed.  I am the oldest. I would not have needed the test if my sisters califications were staged.
